subject: Steroids
lead_paragraph: Sean Sherk, the Ultimate Fighting Championship lightweight champion, had his suspension for steroids cut in half and can return to competition Jan. 6. The California State Athletic Commission reduced the one-year ban after a hearing in Los Angeles. Sherk was suspended for testing positive for nandrolone in July. The U.F.C. already had scheduled an interim lightweight title match between B. J. Penn and Joe Stevenson for Jan. 19 in Newcastle, England.
